text:
“I can help,” Dmitri Prokofitch said. “I know publishers well.”

Dounia’s eyes sparkled. “I like what you’re saying!”

Pulcheria Alexandrovna frowned. “It’s new and untried. We must stay here.”

“What do you think, brother?” Dounia asked Rodya.

“I think it’s a good idea,” Rodya replied. “We could publish five or six books.”

Dmitri nodded. “We’ll start small and grow.”

Rodya smiled. “I know a book that will sell.” 

“Let’s discuss it later,” he added.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The characters discuss the potential of starting a publishing venture, highlighting their confidence in its success and the experience of one member in the business.
